verses.kjv: And it came to pass, that, as he was praying in a certain place, when he ceased, one of his disciples said unto him, Lord, teach us to pray, as John also taught his disciples.
verses.web: When he finished praying in a certain place, one of his disciples said to him, “Lord, teach us to pray, just as John also taught his disciples.”
verses.ct: One day, Jesus was praying in a certain place. When he finished, one of his disciples said to him, "Lord, teach us to pray, just like John taught his disciples."

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, When ye pray, say, Our Father which art in heaven, Hallowed be thy name. Thy kingdom come. Thy will be done, as in heaven, so in earth.
verses.web: He said to them, “When you pray, say, ‘Our Father in heaven, may your name be kept holy. May your Kingdom come. May your will be done on earth, as it is in heaven.
verses.ct: He told them, "When you pray, say: 'Father in heaven, may your name be honored as holy. May your kingdom come. May your will be done on earth, just as it is in heaven.

verses.kjv: Give us day by day our daily bread.
verses.web: Give us day by day our daily bread.
verses.ct: Give us each day the bread we need.

verses.kjv: And forgive us our sins; for we also forgive every one that is indebted to us. And lead us not into temptation; but deliver us from evil.
verses.web: Forgive us our sins, for we ourselves also forgive everyone who is indebted to us. Bring us not into temptation, but deliver us from the evil one.’ ”
verses.ct: Forgive us our sins, for we also forgive everyone who wrongs us. Don't lead us into temptation, but deliver us from evil.'"

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, Which of you shall have a friend, and shall go unto him at midnight, and say unto him, Friend, lend me three loaves;
verses.web: He said to them, “Which of you, if you go to a friend at midnight, and tell him, ‘Friend, lend me three loaves of bread,
verses.ct: Then he said to them, "Imagine you go to a friend's house at midnight and say, 'Friend, lend me 3 loaves of bread.

verses.kjv: For a friend of mine in his journey is come to me, and I have nothing to set before him?
verses.web: for a friend of mine has come to me from a journey, and I have nothing to set before him,’
verses.ct: A friend of mine just showed up from a journey, and I don't have anything to offer him.'

verses.kjv: And he from within shall answer and say, Trouble me not: the door is now shut, and my children are with me in bed; I cannot rise and give thee.
verses.web: and he from within will answer and say, ‘Don’t bother me. The door is now shut, and my children are with me in bed. I can’t get up and give it to you’?
verses.ct: And your friend calls out from inside, 'Don't bother me. The door is already locked, and my children are in bed with me. I can't get up and give you anything.'

verses.kjv: I say unto you, Though he will not rise and give him, because he is his friend, yet because of his importunity he will rise and give him as many as he needeth.
verses.web: I tell you, although he will not rise and give it to him because he is his friend, yet because of his persistence, he will get up and give him as many as he needs.
verses.ct: I'm telling you, even if he won't get up because of friendship alone, he will get up and give you whatever you need because of your bold persistence.

verses.kjv: And I say unto you, Ask, and it shall be given you; seek, and ye shall find; knock, and it shall be opened unto you.
verses.web: “I tell you, keep asking, and it will be given you. Keep seeking, and you will find. Keep knocking, and it will be opened to you.
verses.ct: "So I tell you: keep asking, and it will be given to you. Keep seeking, and you will find. Keep knocking, and the door will be opened for you.

verses.kjv: For every one that asketh receiveth; and he that seeketh findeth; and to him that knocketh it shall be opened.
verses.web: For everyone who asks receives. He who seeks finds. To him who knocks it will be opened.
verses.ct: Because everyone who asks receives. Everyone who seeks finds. And to everyone who knocks, the door will be opened.

verses.kjv: If a son shall ask bread of any of you that is a father, will he give him a stone? or if he ask a fish, will he for a fish give him a serpent?
verses.web: “Which of you fathers, if your son asks for bread, will give him a stone? Or if he asks for a fish, he won’t give him a snake instead of a fish, will he?
verses.ct: "What father among you, if his son asks for bread, would hand him a stone? Or if he asks for a fish, would give him a snake instead?

verses.kjv: Or if he shall ask an egg, will he offer him a scorpion?
verses.web: Or if he asks for an egg, he won’t give him a scorpion, will he?
verses.ct: Or if he asks for an egg, would hand him a scorpion?

verses.kjv: If ye then, being evil, know how to give good gifts unto your children: how much more shall your heavenly Father give the Holy Spirit to them that ask him?
verses.web: If you then, being evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your heavenly Father give the Holy Spirit to those who ask him?”
verses.ct: So if you — flawed as you are — know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your heavenly Father give the Holy Spirit to those who ask him?"

verses.kjv: And he was casting out a devil, and it was dumb. And it came to pass, when the devil was gone out, the dumb spake; and the people wondered.
verses.web: He was casting out a demon, and it was mute. When the demon had gone out, the mute man spoke; and the multitudes marveled.
verses.ct: Jesus was driving out a demon that had made a man unable to speak. When the demon left, the man began talking, and the crowd was amazed.

verses.kjv: But some of them said, He casteth out devils through Beelzebub the chief of the devils.
verses.web: But some of them said, “He casts out demons by Beelzebul, the prince of the demons.”
verses.ct: But some of them said, "He drives out demons by the power of Beelzebub, the ruler of demons."

verses.kjv: And others, tempting him, sought of him a sign from heaven.
verses.web: Others, testing him, sought from him a sign from heaven.
verses.ct: Others, trying to test him, demanded that he perform a miraculous sign from heaven.

verses.kjv: But he, knowing their thoughts, said unto them, Every kingdom divided against itself is brought to desolation; and a house divided against a house falleth.
verses.web: But he, knowing their thoughts, said to them, “Every kingdom divided against itself is brought to desolation. A house divided against itself falls.
verses.ct: But Jesus knew what they were thinking and said to them, "Any kingdom torn apart by civil war will collapse. A household divided against itself will fall.

verses.kjv: If Satan also be divided against himself, how shall his kingdom stand? because ye say that I cast out devils through Beelzebub.
verses.web: If Satan also is divided against himself, how will his kingdom stand? For you say that I cast out demons by Beelzebul.
verses.ct: So if Satan is fighting against himself, how can his kingdom survive? I ask because you're claiming I drive out demons by Beelzebub's power.

verses.kjv: And if I by Beelzebub cast out devils, by whom do your sons cast them out? therefore shall they be your judges.
verses.web: But if I cast out demons by Beelzebul, by whom do your children cast them out? Therefore they will be your judges.
verses.ct: And if I drive out demons by Beelzebub, then by whose power do your own followers drive them out? They themselves will prove you wrong.

verses.kjv: But if I with the finger of God cast out devils, no doubt the kingdom of God is come upon you.
verses.web: But if I by God’s finger cast out demons, then God’s Kingdom has come to you.
verses.ct: But if I drive out demons by the finger of God, then the kingdom of God has arrived right here among you.

verses.kjv: When a strong man armed keepeth his palace, his goods are in peace:
verses.web: “When the strong man, fully armed, guards his own dwelling, his goods are safe.
verses.ct: "When a strong man is fully armed and guards his estate, everything he owns is safe.

verses.kjv: But when a stronger than he shall come upon him, and overcome him, he taketh from him all his armour wherein he trusted, and divideth his spoils.
verses.web: But when someone stronger attacks him and overcomes him, he takes from him his whole armor in which he trusted, and divides his plunder.
verses.ct: But when someone even stronger attacks and overpowers him, that stronger one strips away all the armor he relied on and carries off his possessions.

verses.kjv: He that is not with me is against me: and he that gathereth not with me scattereth.
verses.web: “He that is not with me is against me. He who doesn’t gather with me scatters.
verses.ct: "Whoever is not with me is against me, and whoever doesn't gather with me scatters.

verses.kjv: When the unclean spirit is gone out of a man, he walketh through dry places, seeking rest; and finding none, he saith, I will return unto my house whence I came out.
verses.web: The unclean spirit, when he has gone out of the man, passes through dry places, seeking rest, and finding none, he says, ‘I will turn back to my house from which I came out.’
verses.ct: "When an unclean spirit leaves a person, it wanders through barren places looking for rest. When it finds none, it says, 'I'll go back to the home I left.'

verses.kjv: And when he cometh, he findeth it swept and garnished.
verses.web: When he returns, he finds it swept and put in order.
verses.ct: When it returns, it finds the place swept clean and put in order.

verses.kjv: Then goeth he, and taketh to him seven other spirits more wicked than himself; and they enter in, and dwell there: and the last state of that man is worse than the first.
verses.web: Then he goes, and takes seven other spirits more evil than himself, and they enter in and dwell there. The last state of that man becomes worse than the first.”
verses.ct: Then it goes and brings 7 other spirits more wicked than itself, and they all move in and settle there. That person ends up far worse off than before."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, as he spake these things, a certain woman of the company lifted up her voice, and said unto him, Blessed is the womb that bare thee, and the paps which thou hast sucked.
verses.web: It came to pass, as he said these things, a certain woman out of the multitude lifted up her voice, and said to him, “Blessed is the womb that bore you, and the breasts which nursed you!”
verses.ct: While he was saying these things, a woman in the crowd raised her voice and called out, "Blessed is the mother who gave birth to you and nursed you!"

verses.kjv: But he said, Yea rather, blessed are they that hear the word of God, and keep it.
verses.web: But he said, “On the contrary, blessed are those who hear the word of God, and keep it.”
verses.ct: But Jesus replied, "Even more blessed are those who hear the word of God and obey it."

verses.kjv: And when the people were gathered thick together, he began to say, This is an evil generation: they seek a sign; and there shall no sign be given it, but the sign of Jonas the prophet.
verses.web: When the multitudes were gathering together to him, he began to say, “This is an evil generation. It seeks after a sign. No sign will be given to it but the sign of Jonah, the prophet.
verses.ct: As the crowds grew larger, Jesus began to say, "This is an evil generation. It demands a miraculous sign, but no sign will be given to it except the sign of Jonah the prophet.

verses.kjv: For as Jonas was a sign unto the Ninevites, so shall also the Son of man be to this generation.
verses.web: For even as Jonah became a sign to the Ninevites, so the Son of Man will also be to this generation.
verses.ct: Just as Jonah became a sign to the people of Nineveh, so the Son of Man will be a sign to this generation.

verses.kjv: The queen of the south shall rise up in the judgment with the men of this generation, and condemn them: for she came from the utmost parts of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon; and, behold, a greater than Solomon is here.
verses.web: The Queen of the South will rise up in the judgment with the men of this generation, and will condemn them: for she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon; and behold, one greater than Solomon is here.
verses.ct: The Queen of the South will stand up at the judgment alongside the people of this generation and condemn them, because she traveled from the ends of the earth to hear Solomon's wisdom — and someone greater than Solomon is standing right here.

verses.kjv: The men of Nineve shall rise up in the judgment with this generation, and shall condemn it: for they repented at the preaching of Jonas; and, behold, a greater than Jonas is here.
verses.web: The men of Nineveh will stand up in the judgment with this generation, and will condemn it: for they repented at the preaching of Jonah, and behold, one greater than Jonah is here.
verses.ct: The people of Nineveh will stand up at the judgment alongside this generation and condemn it, because they repented when Jonah preached to them — and someone greater than Jonah is standing right here.

verses.kjv: No man, when he hath lighted a candle, putteth it in a secret place, neither under a bushel, but on a candlestick, that they which come in may see the light.
verses.web: “No one, when he has lit a lamp, puts it in a cellar or under a basket, but on a stand, that those who come in may see the light.
verses.ct: "No one lights a lamp and then hides it away or puts it under a basket. Instead, they set it on a stand so that everyone who comes in can see the light.

verses.kjv: The light of the body is the eye: therefore when thine eye is single, thy whole body also is full of light; but when thine eye is evil, thy body also is full of darkness.
verses.web: The lamp of the body is the eye. Therefore when your eye is good, your whole body is also full of light; but when it is evil, your body also is full of darkness.
verses.ct: Your eye is the lamp of your body. When your eye is healthy, your whole body is full of light. But when your eye is bad, your whole body is full of darkness.

verses.kjv: Take heed therefore that the light which is in thee be not darkness.
verses.web: Therefore see whether the light that is in you isn’t darkness.
verses.ct: So be careful that the light inside you hasn't actually become darkness.

verses.kjv: If thy whole body therefore be full of light, having no part dark, the whole shall be full of light, as when the bright shining of a candle doth give thee light.
verses.web: If therefore your whole body is full of light, having no part dark, it will be wholly full of light, as when the lamp with its bright shining gives you light.”
verses.ct: If your whole body is full of light, with no dark corner left, it will be completely radiant — like when a lamp shines its bright light on you."

verses.kjv: And as he spake, a certain Pharisee besought him to dine with him: and he went in, and sat down to meat.
verses.web: Now as he spoke, a certain Pharisee asked him to dine with him. He went in, and sat at the table.
verses.ct: When Jesus finished speaking, a Pharisee invited him to eat at his house. So Jesus went in and took his place at the table.

verses.kjv: And when the Pharisee saw it, he marvelled that he had not first washed before dinner.
verses.web: When the Pharisee saw it, he marveled that he had not first washed himself before dinner.
verses.ct: The Pharisee was surprised to see that Jesus didn't perform the ritual hand-washing before the meal.

verses.kjv: And the Lord said unto him, Now do ye Pharisees make clean the outside of the cup and the platter; but your inward part is full of ravening and wickedness.
verses.web: The Lord said to him, “Now you Pharisees cleanse the outside of the cup and of the platter, but your inward part is full of extortion and wickedness.
verses.ct: The Lord said to him, "You Pharisees clean the outside of the cup and the plate, but inside you're full of greed and wickedness.

verses.kjv: Ye fools, did not he that made that which is without make that which is within also?
verses.web: You foolish ones, didn’t he who made the outside make the inside also?
verses.ct: You fools! Didn't the one who made the outside also make the inside?

verses.kjv: But rather give alms of such things as ye have; and, behold, all things are clean unto you.
verses.web: But give for gifts to the needy those things which are within, and behold, all things will be clean to you.
verses.ct: Instead, give generously to the poor from what you have, and then everything will be clean for you.

verses.kjv: But woe unto you, Pharisees! for ye tithe mint and rue and all manner of herbs, and pass over judgment and the love of God: these ought ye to have done, and not to leave the other undone.
verses.web: But woe to you Pharisees! For you tithe mint and rue and every herb, but you bypass justice and God’s love. You ought to have done these, and not to have left the other undone.
verses.ct: "But how terrible it will be for you Pharisees! You carefully tithe your mint, rue, and every little herb, but you completely ignore justice and the love of God. You should have practiced these things without neglecting the others.

verses.kjv: Woe unto you, Pharisees! for ye love the uppermost seats in the synagogues, and greetings in the markets.
verses.web: Woe to you Pharisees! For you love the best seats in the synagogues, and the greetings in the marketplaces.
verses.ct: "How terrible it will be for you Pharisees! You love the most important seats in the synagogues and being greeted with respect in the marketplaces.

verses.kjv: Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! for ye are as graves which appear not, and the men that walk over them are not aware of them.
verses.web: Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you are like hidden graves, and the men who walk over them don’t know it.”
verses.ct: "How terrible it will be for you, scribes and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You're like unmarked graves that people walk over without even knowing it."

verses.kjv: Then answered one of the lawyers, and said unto him, Master, thus saying thou reproachest us also.
verses.web: One of the lawyers answered him, “Teacher, in saying this you insult us also.”
verses.ct: One of the experts in the law spoke up and said, "Teacher, when you say these things, you're insulting us too."

verses.kjv: And he said, Woe unto you also, ye lawyers! for ye lade men with burdens grievous to be borne, and ye yourselves touch not the burdens with one of your fingers.
verses.web: He said, “Woe to you lawyers also! For you load men with burdens that are difficult to carry, and you yourselves won’t even lift one finger to help carry those burdens.
verses.ct: Jesus replied, "How terrible it will be for you experts in the law as well! You pile heavy burdens on people's backs that are almost impossible to carry, but you won't lift a single finger to help them.

verses.kjv: Woe unto you! for ye build the sepulchres of the prophets, and your fathers killed them.
verses.web: Woe to you! For you build the tombs of the prophets, and your fathers killed them.
verses.ct: "How terrible it will be for you! You build impressive tombs for the prophets, but it was your own ancestors who killed them.

verses.kjv: Truly ye bear witness that ye allow the deeds of your fathers: for they indeed killed them, and ye build their sepulchres.
verses.web: So you testify and consent to the works of your fathers. For they killed them, and you build their tombs.
verses.ct: By doing this, you show that you approve of what your ancestors did. They murdered the prophets, and you build their monuments.

verses.kjv: Therefore also said the wisdom of God, I will send them prophets and apostles, and some of them they shall slay and persecute:
verses.web: Therefore also the wisdom of God said, ‘I will send to them prophets and apostles; and some of them they will kill and persecute,
verses.ct: "That's why the wisdom of God declared, 'I will send them prophets and apostles. Some of them they will kill, and others they will persecute.'

verses.kjv: That the blood of all the prophets, which was shed from the foundation of the world, may be required of this generation;
verses.web: that the blood of all the prophets, which was shed from the foundation of the world, may be required of this generation;
verses.ct: As a result, this generation will be held accountable for the blood of every prophet shed since the world began —

verses.kjv: From the blood of Abel unto the blood of Zacharias, which perished between the altar and the temple: verily I say unto you, It shall be required of this generation.
verses.web: from the blood of Abel to the blood of Zachariah, who perished between the altar and the sanctuary.’ Yes, I tell you, it will be required of this generation.
verses.ct: from the blood of Abel all the way to the blood of Zachariah, who was killed between the altar and the sanctuary. Yes, I'm telling you, this generation will answer for all of it.

verses.kjv: Woe unto you, lawyers! for ye have taken away the key of knowledge: ye entered not in yourselves, and them that were entering in ye hindered.
verses.web: Woe to you lawyers! For you took away the key of knowledge. You didn’t enter in yourselves, and those who were entering in, you hindered.”
verses.ct: "How terrible it will be for you experts in the law! You've taken away the key to knowledge. You didn't enter in yourselves, and you blocked those who were trying to enter."

verses.kjv: And as he said these things unto them, the scribes and the Pharisees began to urge him vehemently, and to provoke him to speak of many things:
verses.web: As he said these things to them, the scribes and the Pharisees began to be terribly angry, and to draw many things out of him;
verses.ct: After Jesus left that place, the scribes and the Pharisees became furiously hostile toward him, bombarding him with questions about all kinds of topics,

verses.kjv: Laying wait for him, and seeking to catch something out of his mouth, that they might accuse him.
verses.web: lying in wait for him, and seeking to catch him in something he might say, that they might accuse him.
verses.ct: setting traps for him and trying to catch him saying something they could use against him.
